p: The macromineral content of phosphorus (P), magnesium (Mg), and potassium (K) was determined in the three different samples. All samples were digested with 4 mL of NHO 3 and 2 mL of H 2O 2. Then 0.5 g of the sample was diluted in 50 mL. Some tubes were spiked with 1 ppm of P, Mg, and K each. One blank was spiked with 5 ppm of P, Mg, and K. Minerals were determined via inductively coupled plasma-atomic emission spectrometry (ICP-AES) [ 25]. All the above analyses were done in triplicate.
